questions.question: Select a diagnosis
Select a diagnosis
Select a diagnosis.
Select the most appropriate management
questions.optiona: L3-5 central decompression and posterolateral fusion
questions.optionb: L4-5 central decompression, posterolateral instrumented fusion of L4-5
questions.optiond: L3-5 central decompression with posterior lumbar interbody fusion

questions.question: During the procedure a CSF leak is encountered. Select the appropriate management.
questions.optiona: Water tight closure with 7-0 proline suture fixation, augmented with fibrin sealant
questions.optionb: Fibrin glue analogue with direct compression until leak stops
questions.optionc: Water tight closure with 5-0 vicryl suture fixation, augmented with fibrin sealant
questions.optiond: Fat patch augmented closure using 7-0 proline suture fixation

questions.question: Which nerve root is most likely to be injured during this procedure?
Fluoroscopy is used to identify your level intraoperatively. A penfield 4 is placed in the L4-5 interlaminar space. This will point to which pedicle?
A subtotal discectomy is performed and the patient is transported to the PACU safely. Postoperatively they complain of numbness on the right thigh. The most likely cause is
questions.optionc: Stretch of the femoral nerve during positioning

The transverse ligament in this case is likely

questions.optionb: Posterior C1-2 fixation using C1 lateral mass C2 pars screws

questions.question: Which type of fluoroscopy would you like to call for?
The approach for C2 odontoid screw is best performed at
questions.optiona: At the C2 skin level which is the hyoid superficially
questions.optionb: At the level of C3 which is the level of the hyoid
questions.optionc: At the level of C5 which is at the thyroid cartilage
questions.optiond: At the level of the C6 which is the cricoid tubercle superficially.

questions.question: In the Grauer modification of Anderson and D'Alonzo's classification of type 2 odontoid fractures they separate three types by morphology.
questions.optiona: Grauer type A are best treated with odontoid screws
questions.optionb: Grauer type B are best treated with posterior stabilization
questions.optionc: Grauer type C fractures are best treated with odontoid screws
questions.optiond: Grauer A are best treated with external immobilization if nondisplaced

questions.question: Which type of fluoroscopy would you like to call for?
The approach for C2 odontoid screw is best performed at
questions.optiona: At the C2 skin level which is the hyoid superficially
questions.optionb: At the level of C3 which is the level of the hyoid
questions.optionc: At the level of C5 which is at the thyroid cartilage
questions.optiond: At the level of the C6 which is the cricoid tubercle superficially.

questions.question: In the Grauer modification of Anderson and D'Alonzo's classification of type 2 odontoid fractures they separate three types by morphology.
questions.optiona: Grauer type A are best treated with odontoid screws
questions.optionb: Grauer type B are best treated with posterior stabilization
questions.optionc: Grauer type C fractures are best treated with odontoid screws
questions.optiond: Grauer A are best treated with external immobilization if nondisplaced

questions.question: Select a diagnosis
questions.optionb: CT demonstrates evidence of potential subaxial segmental dynamic instability

questions.question: Powers rule assesses
questions.optiona: The distance from the basion-anterior arch C1 divided by the opisthion -posterior arch C1
questions.optionb: Basion to opisthion distance over anterior to posterior arch distance
questions.optionc: Basion to posterior arch of C1 divided by the opisthion to anterior arch of C1
questions.optiond: Opisthion to anterior arch distance divided by the basion to anterior arch distance

questions.question: A normal value of Power's ratio is
Harris rule of 12's states
questions.optiona: Basion dens interval or basion posterior axial interval should be < 12mm
questions.optionb: Basion to posterior arch inverval should be less than 12 degrees
questions.optionc: Opisthion to posterior arch line should be within 12mm from the anterior cervical line
questions.optiond: Basion to opisthion distance should be 12mm or less

questions.question: The Traynelis classification of OC joint disruption
questions.optionb: References the degree of disruption in millimeters
questions.optionc: References the difference between bony vs ligamentous injuries
questions.optiond: References isolated OC injuries vs combined injuries

questions.question: OC junction disruption is best diagnosed with
OC junction disruption is classically treated with occipitocervical fusion. The safe zone for occipital screws is
questions.optiona: Unicortical screws within 10mm of the external occipital protuberance
questions.optionb: Bicortical screws within 20mm of the external occipital protuberance
questions.optionc: Unicortical screws within 5mm of the external occipital protuberance
questions.optiond: Bicortical screws within 2cm inferior to the transverse sinus

questions.question: OC junction fixation typically relies on
questions.optiona: Occipital plate fixation, C1 lateral mass, C2 pars/pedicle, C3 lateral mass fixation
questions.optionb: Occipital plate fixation, C1 lateral mass, C2 lateral mass, C3 lateral mass fixation
questions.optionc: Occipital plate fixation, C1 pars screw, C2 lateral mass, C3 lateral mass fixation
questions.optiond: Occipital plate fixation, C1 lateral mass fixation, C2 pedicle fixation, C3 pedicle fixation

questions.question: Select a diagnosis
The incidence of spinal cord injuries with occipital condyle fractures is
This structure connects the posterior body of the axis to the anterior foramen magnum
This particular case is best treated
A collar should be utilized for a minimum of
Flexion extension views in follow up clinic following 3 months of nonoperative treatment in a collar are likely to reveal
Intraoperatively, is a decompression recommended?
The occipital plate is attempted with bicortical fixation. The first screw hole is drilled revealing significant hemorrhage from the skull. What should be done?
questions.optiona: Investigate the source of the bleeding
questions.optionb: Place the screw in the bleeding hole
questions.optionc: Tamponade the hole with a sponge and re-assess in 2 minutes

questions.question: The C1 lateral mass is drilled and tapped without complication. Following placement of the screw significant venous bleeding is encountered. What should be done?
questions.optiona: Pack with a sponge and begin a similar procedure on the contralateral side
questions.optionb: Investigate the source of the bleeding
questions.optionc: Intraoperative angiography to rule out arterial bleed
questions.optiond: Proceed with the surgery without packing

questions.question: In this operation C1 fixation was abandoned due to significant bleeding bilaterally. It is evident by reading the post-operative CT scans that C2 was fixed with
A criticism of the occipital fixation is
questions.optiona: It is too inferior relative to the external occipital protuberance
questions.optionb: It is too superior relative to the external occipital protuberance
questions.optiond: The plate is not flush with the protuberance

questions.question: The C3 lateral mass fixation should be criticized As it is not parallel to the facet joint
questions.optionb: It has a start point far too medial
questions.optionc: It is short with poor bony purchase

questions.question: Overall alignment of the head and neck in this fixation
questions.optiona: Is adequate and should not lead to excessive dysphagia postoperatively
questions.optionb: Is in excessive flexion and will likely lead to postoperative dysphagia
questions.optionc: Is in excessive extension and will likely lead to postoperative dysphagia
